reviews.review_msg: Great prof. I took this course back in Spring 2020 before COVID. Must take course if you're into video games, it's very relatable. Quizzes were straightforward, some group assignments (depends on. your team), and individual assignments were interesting. A final project about your favourite game, and you analyze it. As well as a final.
The exams consisted of stuff from lecture, and we played games throughout the course. Not much else to say. Easy GPA booster, and passionate prof.

Ivan is an amazing professor and was very organized. He made a private discord server where everyone chatted about assignments and asked questions. We also got to play a few games every lecture. The final exam and all the quizzes were open book.

Honestly just such a pleasant guy to work with. He is genuinely nice and wants students to succeed. He is always willing to help and provide references on extremely short notice. If a course is available with Ivan as the instructor, take it.

Ivan was extremely helpful throughout the term and explained all the assignments very clearly. If you are facing any difficulties, dont be afraid to contact him! He has been very understanding of my situations and is overall a very approachable guy. Definitely take IAT210 with him if you have the chance. As long as you keep up, you will do great.
Very caring, respected, and genuine person and a REALLY good instructor. He makes it all easy for you if you pay attention. Also participation and the textbook are surprisingly fun for this class.

Ivan was great, he wasn't the most interactive online, but he would have been great in-person. He really loved what he was teaching and actually cared about the students. The course material was relatively easy and he explained it pretty well. Overall great proff and I suggest taking him any day for this course.
Great teacher for this course, really passionate about the material and loves to teach. Class wasn't difficult to grasp and the homework was very simple and straightforward.
Very interesting content, well made lecture slides! Workload was manageable and reasonable! Chills and enjoying the course!

Hes a rlly gud prof, and goes through slides perfectly. Hes lectures are really long but thats expected since the class is suppose to be 3 hours for every thursday. The only downslide is that he gives the lectures late so you have to copy the lecture slides on your own notes when hes talking. He also played the "Revenge" minecraft song lol

This guy puts people to sleep. The class is so easy it's boring. He spends 20 minutes on 1 slide and there will be 100+ slides a lecture. Despite how easy this class is, I would not take it again. Boring lectures and forced to show up as there are in-class assignments. I took this course because I was interested in game design, but it's a trap

Great prof, very understanding during COVID19. Follow rubric on assignments, and A should be achievable. Try to answer at least once during class for participation points (very easy), if you're into games, most fundamentals should be easy. In terms of textbook, you can find all articles online, his txtbook is just a compiled paper copy of it.
One of the most understanding profs I've ever had. If you study his lecture slides and notes the course is very easy. Just make sure to follow criteria for assignments very carefully.
